item.title: Toon Tunes - The Flintstones
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C (Transposed down from the original).
Chords Used: G, C, Dm7, D7, G7, Dm, Em, F, E7, A7, Am7, Fm
The theme song from The Flintstones.
Tutorial Video (GCEA & DGBE): https://youtu.be/SxhKRWp3zx0
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is available at ukefarm.com.
Do you have a request for a song to be made into a video? First, check the index of play alongs at www.ukeplayalongs.com to make sure your song isn't already available. If it isn't, please fill out this request form: https://forms.gle/84rgm7kFNJWnTqFB6
We cannot promise that a request will be made into a play along, but we do appreciate your recommendations!
Interested in UkeStuff merchandise? https://teespring.com/stores/ukestuff
Check out the UkeStuff Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Radio Public, Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
And you are invited to visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Bill Withers - Lovely Day
item.description:
This tutorial will show you how to play Lovely Day on the ukulele by Bill Withers. The chords used are F Dm7 Bbmaj7 Bbm7 Cm7 Eb C#maj7(Dbmaj7)
If you found this video useful please subscribe and share with your friends. If you want to be notified of future videos please click on bell next to subscribe.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The uke chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com

item.title: Israel Kamakawiwo'ole - What A Wonderful World
item.description:
Performed by Israel Kamakawiwo'ole. Written by Harold Arlen & E.Y. Harburg / George David Weiss & Bob Thiele & Israel Kamakawiwo'ole
The ukulele song for me and I guess for countless others. It got me into uke playing so I wanted to make a easy-to-follow version for other Iz fans out there.
The picture is of young Iz. I don't have the info of the photographer but I hope they will not mind me using it here. Iz has gone behind the rainbow long ago but I can't help wondering if he, as a kid or even later on in his life, ever dreamed of becoming the much loved artist he grew up to be.
I wanted to make a version where you can follow either chord markings in the text of the regular ones at the bottom of the video (or both).
For strumming help, see this helpful video from the wonderful Cynthia Lin: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qqDiaZ-pqyA
Note: The rather complicated Dm7 can be played as a regular Dm as well.

item.title: Simon & Garfunkel - The 59th Street Bridge Song
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of F. Raised from the original key almost a whole step (170 cents).
As performed by Simon & Garfunkel.
This is a great song to practice using your pinky! Leave the pinky finger on the first string, third fret, all the time!
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts and Google Play.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Meghan Trainor - Just a Friend to You
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of
As performed by Meghan Trainor. Most of the chord charts of this song show standard chords...but it doesn’t take long to play with the recording to realize that Meghan Trainor uses some modified (but not overly difficult) chords instead of 1st position chords on the ukulele. This play along attempts to follow her chords as much as possible. Look for an added note (1st string, 3rd fret) through much of the song. And in the final progressions, Play Fm to C by leaving C with your 4th finger (pinky). This should be a nice song to challenge players who are ready to start playing beyond 1st position. Enjoy!
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Gael García Bernal - Remember Me
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C. Not easy! Short version of the song in C.
As performed by Gael García Bernal and Gabriella Flores and Libertad García Fonzi.
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
The colored font matches Aquila KIDS ukulele strings.
This version matches the educational Color Chord approach and uses four chords: C (red sticker), G (green stickers), F (yellow stickers) and Am (blue sticker).
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Sesame Street - Bein' Green
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C.
This is not the easiest song. Raised up from the original Key of Bb, and slowed down to about 80% of the original key.
This is an edited video...I had originally forgot to add the list of chords in the song.
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.

item.title: Christina Perri - A Thousand Years
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of C(?)
As performed by Christina Perri
I'll be honest..this was a fun one to work on. It is shifted up a whole step from the original recording. None of the online lead sheets matched what I was hearing..and I tried to incorporate some of the passing tones with chords like Cmaj7. In this key, the song is pretty straightforward and fun to play. Listen to the song for strumming pattern ideas (e.g. single strums at the beginning).
Need to practice at a different tempo? Use the gear icon in the video (lower right) to slow down (or speed up) the tempo at pitch! Need to do so on an iPad or iPhone? Check out the browser called "iCab Mobile" which has a Module called "Video Playback Rate"
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
